response.answer_text: Java, derived from C and C++, is an object-oriented programming language having a simple object model. Java has helped programmers in simplifying the coding and developing applications and installing them on cross-platform systems. We find Java applications on desktops, laptops, mobiles, tablets, embedded devices, cloud computing servers and also supercomputers. Today Java is the most widely used software platforms for developing applications, whether used client-side or server-side. WHY LEARN JAVA? Java is an open-source programming language.It is platform independent and also provides multi-platform support.It provides APIs (Application Programming Interface) that are very easy to access.Java has the provision for garbage collection, helping users to manage memory.Java provides robust online services support.Java helps you to build very dynamic web applications and also reusable codes.Java Programmers are highly in demand, earning good salaries in top MNCs.Java has a very strong community which is well-knit and very helpful.Java is used everywhere. It has become omnipresent – all devices, all platforms!It is a very flexible programming language, and very easy to learn for beginners.REMUNERATION: A fresher Java can earn upto 4-5 lakhs p.a. With experience and globally recognized certifications, Java Programmers can earn as high as 12-13 lakhs p.a. COMPANIES HIRING JAVA PROFESSIONALS: Most of the top MNCs as well as start-ups are hunting for Java Professionals. Whether it is Infosys, Accenture, IBM, TCS, demand for Java Professionals is on a rise! Google, Amazon, LinkedIn, Blogger, Ebay, Twitter, all use Java to build useful applications.
